issue.title: [Question/Fuature Request] HttpEndpoint multi-node supported?
Workflow Persistence
issue.body:
Hi Team,
I want to know about how to store Workflow using Entity Framework Core provider and MSSQLServer DB. How to store workflow in MSSQL Server DB table?

comment.body:
Hi, I tried the same thing but getting below issue

A connection was successfully established with the server, but then an error occurred during the login process. (provider: SSL Provider, error: 0 - The certificate chain was issued by an authority that is not trusted.)'

commits.message: Update ActivityNotFoundActivity to throw exception when executed

pull_request.title: Update NotFoundActivity display text + description
pull_request.body:
This PR ensures that the "Not Found" text is always displayed, instead of any custom display texts.

### === auto-pr-body ===



Summary:
This pull request updates the ActivityPropertyExtensions class to allow for the flagging of an activity to execute synchronously or asynchronously, and adds methods to get and set the display text and description of the activity.

List of Changes:
- Added flag to allow for the flagging of an activity to execute either synchronously or asynchronously
- Added method to get and set the display text and description of the activity 

Refactoring Target:
- Introduce an enum type for ActivityKind to help clarify behavior at the call site
- Use better descriptive strings in the method documentation to make the code easier to reason about

labels.name: elsa 3
labels.description: This issue is specific to Elsa 3

pull_request.title: Update NotFoundActivity display text + description
pull_request.body: This PR ensures that the "Not Found" text is always displayed, instead of any custom display texts.

issue.title: Elsa 3 - Journal not working with Postgres

labels.name: elsa 3
labels.description: This issue is specific to Elsa 3

issue.body:
Hey again,
right now I'm trying to use the Journal functionality of the Elsa 3 Dashboard (so no Studio this time).

I've created some small workflow to test, which just simply listens to an HTTP endpoint and writes to the console. The workflow executes, but no information is display in the journal, alongside with errors in the console when clicking on an activity:

![Screenshot 2023-09-01 105233](https://github.com/elsa-workflows/elsa-core/assets/140689609/cd58d03b-8cce-46ce-a0b4-1e20375b12f3)
![Screenshot 2023-09-01 105254](https://github.com/elsa-workflows/elsa-core/assets/140689609/b338f1e8-d554-4819-b3b1-431a46609326)

I've noticed that you explained in an [discussion ](https://github.com/elsa-workflows/elsa-core/discussions/3730)that `UseWorkflowRuntime` needs to be used. But it seems as the code in this discussion is outdated, or not usable with EF Core and Postgres. I.e. `UseAsyncWorkflowStateExporter` seems to not exist anymore.

I could not test it with SQLite, as the NuGet Package `Elsa.EntityFrameworkCore.Sqlite` is still stuck on RC1, and all my other packages are already using preview 682.

labels.name: elsa 3

issue.body:
Hey again,

I've created some small workflow to test, which just simply listens to an HTTP endpoint and writes to the console. The workflow executes, but no information is display in the journal, alongside with errors in the console when clicking on an activity:

![Screenshot 2023-09-01 105233](https://github.com/elsa-workflows/elsa-core/assets/140689609/cd58d03b-8cce-46ce-a0b4-1e20375b12f3)

comment.body: Then I think I know. The extensions for PostgreSQL weren added later, and given that you’re using the preview hot fix package, I think it may have been added after that version. The latest version(808) should have the extension method. Let me know if you can’t find it.
